# Solar Training Interview Analysis for Mosul, Iraq (Interview 4 - Mohammed Al-Qatan)

## Trainer Profile
### Experience level

EXPLICITLY STATED: Has installed approximately 40 megawatts of solar projects
> "مشاريع يعني عبرت آ تقريبا عبرت ال40 ميجا أنا منفذ تقريبا" (Projects that have exceeded approximately 40 megawatts that I have implemented)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Has trained over 100 people
> "عبرت المية" (Exceeded one hundred)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Conducts 10-15 trainings each summer
> "آه كل صيف عندي لا يقل عن عشت إلى 15" (Every summer I have no less than 10 to 15)

EXPLICITLY STATED: First major project was in 2020 with 110 panels
> "أول مشروع بسنة 2020. اشتغلت أول مدرسة بالموصل آه بسنة 2020، كان عبارة المشروع عن أكبر منظومة طاقة شمسية بالموصل 110 لوح وقتها" (First project in 2020. I worked on the first school in Mosul in 2020, which was the largest solar power system in Mosul at the time with 110 panels)

### Areas of expertise

EXPLICITLY STATED: Large-scale commercial installations
> "المعامل نشتغل على نظام إي جدا كبير، يعني نظام الأونيقريد هذاك" (For factories we work on very large systems, meaning the on-grid system)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Residential system design
> "المنزل يحتاج ندرس تفاصيل البيت نفسه" (The home requires studying the details of the house itself)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Structural engineering for mounting systems
> "كل حسابات هندسية أشتغل عليها من ناحية ثقالات، من ناحية النوع ال. الحديد المستخدم" (All engineering calculations I work on in terms of loads, type of metal used)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Installation team management
> "الفريق 30 شخص" (The team is 30 people)

### Qualifications and background

EXPLICITLY STATED: Taken specialized training courses from international experts
> "أنا ماخذ دورات أصلا بالمجال بسنة 2018، 19 واحد من ألمانيا، واللاخ من تركيا" (I have taken courses in the field in 2018, 19, one from Germany and another from Turkey)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Continues personal supervision of installations
> "أنا أطلع بعد الكوادر، يعني على سبيل المثال. أنا هاليوم الصبح كنت طلعوا الشباب، كان ركبوا هم التصميم من عندهم والتفاصيل وهاي بس ينسون، أنا أنبه" (I follow up after the staff. For example, this morning I went out to check on the team, they had installed according to their design and details but they forgot some things, I remind them)

INFERRED - HIGH: Engineering background based on technical knowledge and calculations
> Based on his discussion of engineering calculations and detailed technical knowledge

### Teaching philosophy

EXPLICITLY STATED: Strongly emphasizes hands-on learning over theory
> "أول يوم تفصيل عملي، شنو هذا الإنفرتر نفتحه؟ هو راح يشوف عملي، ما عدنا شي اسمه نظري، نحنا، نحنا كله عمل" (First day practical details, what is this inverter let's open it? He will see practically, we don't have anything called theory, we are all practical work)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Visual learning over note-taking
> "نحنا ما عنا شي اسمه ورقة، وقلم نحنا الكورس المتلقي، أريده يحفظه، ما أريد، آ، يجي ورقة وقلم ويتابع ورقة" (We don't have anything called paper and pen, I want the trainee to memorize the course, I don't want him to come with paper and pen and follow notes)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Uses plain language rather than technical terms
> "أحكي بصورة عامية، لأن موضوع اللي دائما نيجي نحكي بيه بأمر علمي إي المتلقي يعتبر هذا الأمر درس" (I speak in colloquial terms, because when we always talk about matters in scientific terms, the recipient considers this a lesson)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Regular verification of understanding through group discussion
> "نهاية كل يوم، إي نحكي؟ كل شخص شو متعلم" (End of each day, we talk about what each person learned)

### Recommendation Summary:
Leverage Mohammed's extensive practical experience with over 40 megawatts of solar installations and his team leadership skills. His approach emphasizes hands-on, visual learning from day one with almost no theory. Incorporate his teaching philosophy of using everyday language rather than technical terms, and his practice of daily verification of learning through group discussion. His background in both large commercial installations and residential systems provides valuable perspective on the different requirements of each market segment. Use his engineering expertise to ensure proper attention to structural aspects of mounting systems, which are critical for safety and longevity.

## Local Context Insights
### Specific challenges in Mosul's solar market

EXPLICITLY STATED: Mismatch between inverters and panels
> "أبسط مثال أكو أجهزة إنفرترات يجي الفولت مالتها مثلا من 120 إلى 450... راح يصير عنده مشكلة بالفولت، وما راح يشتغل عند الإنفرتر، واحتمال يشتعل" (Simplest example, there are inverter devices where the voltage is from 120 to 450... he will have a problem with the voltage, and it won't work with the inverter, and it might catch fire)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Mounting systems failing in wind
> "واقعين نصور البينورات، يعني أدوا ناس" (Falling panels, meaning people have experienced this)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Battery-inverter communication problems
> "التواصل ما بين البطارية. لأن هذه البطارية بي بي عقل ذكي، البي أم أس" (The communication between the battery. Because this battery has a smart brain, the BMS)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Improper wire selection
> "يختار ال ال ال السلك المستخدم الك حجم السلك، إي إنه هذا هل صحيح أو خطأ، ونوعية السلك لازم يكون متوافق مع حجم الأمبير والفولتيه" (He chooses the used wire, the wire size, whether this is correct or wrong, and the wire type must be compatible with the amperage and voltage)

### Local installation practices and adaptations

EXPLICITLY STATED: Need for careful site assessment before installation
> "أول مشكلة وأهم مشكلة... لا تتفق مع زبون، إذا ما تروح تشوف بيته السطح مع البيت والمكان تنصب بيه" (The first and most important problem... don't agree with a customer if you don't go see his roof and house and the place where you'll install)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Different approaches for residential vs. commercial installations
> "فرق بين اللي. المنزل، وبين المعامل، فرق كل شي كبير" (The difference between residential and factory applications is very big in everything)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Tailoring systems to specific customer priorities
> "كل بيت، لواء أولوياته، لواء أجهزته الخاصة" (Every house has its priorities, its special devices)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Detailed engineering calculations for mounting
> "كل حسابات هندسية أشتغل عليها من ناحية ثقالات، من ناحية النوع ال. الحديد المستخدم" (All engineering calculations I work on in terms of loads, type of metal used)

### Cultural considerations for training delivery

EXPLICITLY STATED: Using everyday language for better understanding
> "أحكي بصورة عامية... بينما إذا نيجي نحكي أمثلة، و آ هذا هذا الكتر، وهذا البلايص، وهاي جوزها هيتشي... يفهم" (I speak in colloquial terms... but if we come and give examples, and [show] this cutter, this pliers, and this connector... they understand)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Trainees may be reluctant to admit not understanding
> "خصوصا نحنا عم نتعامل بجوز اي اي بمرحلة شوية كبار بالعمر، فما حدا يعترف بالقطع" (Especially since we are dealing with people who are a bit older in age, so no one admits [not knowing] definitively)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Preference for visual learning over academic approach
> "نحنا ما عنا شي اسمه ورقة، وقلم" (We don't have anything called paper and pen)

EXPLICITLY STATED: Need to make technical content approachable

# Comprehensive Merged Recommendations

## Optimal Training Structure

### Overall Approach
- **Practical Focus**: All trainers emphasized that Iraqi learners respond best to hands-on, practical training. Minimize theoretical content and maximize hands-on experience.
- **Visual Learning**: Emphasize visual demonstration over written materials, following Mohammed's recommendation for no note-taking and visual learning.
- **Qualified Participants**: Start with participants who have some technical background (electrical engineering or similar) rather than complete beginners.
- **Spaced vs. Concentrated Learning**: Consider Ali's recommendation to space training days (Thursday-Friday over several weeks) or Mohammed's six consecutive days, based on logistical constraints.
- **Professional Setting**: Ensure training venue and meals are high quality to enhance credibility (Ali).
